intro: Sorindeia doeringii, commonly known as the Brazilian starwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the rainforests of Brazil. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
